carousel_items: Makes you urinate more often, so don't take it at bedtime.
Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how it affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked one week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun, so use proper protections.

basics.benefits_moa: Aldactazide is a combination medicine that lowers your blood pressure with two diuretics (water pills), hydrochlorothiazide and spironolactone. They act on different parts of your kidney to get rid of extra fluids.
basics.bottom_line: Aldactazide removes excess fluid in your body and lowers your blood pressure, while helping keep your potassium levels safe.
downsides: Many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs blood tests to monitor electrolytes and kidney function.
Can make you urinate more often.
Can make you sensitive to sunlight.
Shouldn't take it if you have a sulfa allergy.

downsides_processed.orig: Many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs blood tests to monitor electrolytes and kidney function.
Can make you urinate more often.
Can make you sensitive to sunlight.
Shouldn't take it if you have a sulfa allergy.

upsides: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
Gets rid of extra fluids in your body.
Helpful for people who tend to have low potassium levels.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
Gets rid of extra fluids in your body.
Helpful for people who tend to have low potassium levels.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure. Removes extra water from your body.
drugs.name: Aldactazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Makes you urinate more often, so don't take it at bedtime.
Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how it affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked one week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun, so use proper protections.

risks_warnings.title: Tumor development
risks_warnings.description: Use of Aldactazide in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, and should only be used for FDA approved indications.

description_processed.orig: Use of Aldactazide in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, and should only be used for FDA approved indications.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle problems due to electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can affect levels of certain electrolytes (sodium, magnesium) that can cause muscle weakness/spasms or unexplained tiredness. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your electrolytes and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can affect levels of certain electrolytes (sodium, magnesium) that can cause muscle weakness/spasms or unexplained tiredness. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your electrolytes and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with hydrochlorothiazide in Aldactazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with hydrochlorothiazide in Aldactazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Breast pain or swelling
risks_warnings.description: Aldactazide can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine.

description_processed.orig: Aldactazide can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine.

images.labeler: G.D. Searle LLC Division of Pfizer Inc
G.D. Searle LLC Division of Pfizer Inc

carousel_items: Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how the medicine affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
You can have breast pain/swelling, irregular periods (women), or trouble with sexual performance.
Tell your doctor about any muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can take 2 to 3 days to see full diuretic effects and 2 to 3 weeks to see blood pressure lowering effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Spironolactone is a potassium-sparing diuretic that blocks aldosterone (a hormone) and helps the kidney get rid of excess fluids in your body.
basics.bottom_line: Spironolactone is helpful when added to another diuretic to get rid of excess fluid in your body. Doesn't work well on its own.
downsides: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

downsides_processed.orig: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

upsides: Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
More useful when taken with another diuretic that'll also help your body get rid of extra fluids.
Reduces the risk of death in people with heart failure.

upsides_processed.orig: Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
More useful when taken with another diuretic that'll also help your body get rid of extra fluids.
Reduces the risk of death in people with heart failure.

drugs.one_liner: Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I took Lasix for the past few months and it took the major lower extremities swelling down in the ER. Then was switched to this drug (Spironolactone) and swelling is back, 9 lbs put on in 24 hours! Very upsetting as it is the weekend.
Caused enlarged breasts, and sore nipples, as well as high glucose levels. scary stuff
I wish I had started at a higher dose from the start. 25mg did nothing, now months later, I'm on 100mg and it's much more effective.
might make you feel tired like beta blockers.

drugs.name: Aldactone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how the medicine affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
You can have breast pain/swelling, irregular periods (women), or trouble with sexual performance.
Tell your doctor about any muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can take 2 to 3 days to see full diuretic effects and 2 to 3 weeks to see blood pressure lowering effects.

risks_warnings.title: Tumor development
risks_warnings.description: Use of Spironolactone in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, so it should only be used for FDA-approved indications.

description_processed.orig: Use of Spironolactone in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, so it should only be used for FDA-approved indications.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems from high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Breast pain or swelling
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine, but rarely can be irreversible.

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine, but rarely can be irreversible.

carousel_items: Take each dose with a meal and full glass of water or other liquid.
Doses more than 20mEq should be split up and given twice a day.
You can also take a lower dose of Potassium chloride and eat extra foods that are high in potassium. Ask your doctor.
Tell your doctor if the tablets get stuck in your throat or you have trouble swallowing them. There may be other dosage forms you can try that work better for you.
Don't chew, crush or suck on the tablets, swallow them whole. The tablets can also be split in half (on the line), then that piece swallowed whole.
Even though the active medicine is completely absorbed, the empty shell capsule/tablet may not be and could show up in your stool. Don't be alarmed.
If using powder, you'll need to completely mix and dissolve one packet of in a minimum of 4-5 ounces of water or other liquid.
Some capsules can be opened and the medicine sprinkled onto soft food (applesauce, yogurt), then swallowed without chewing.

basics.benefits_moa: Potassium chloride is a supplement that raises potassium levels in your blood. Potassium is essential for heart, nerve, and muscle function, and other important processes in your body. Blood potassium has to stay in a narrow range, so very small potassium level changes can have significant effects.
basics.bottom_line: Potassium chloride works well to replace potassium that's low because of certain medications or conditions. Extended-release formulas are easier to put up with.
downsides: Potassium chloride causes nausea, vomiting, gas, belly pain, and diarrhea. Taking the extended release formulas or smaller doses with food will help.
You'll need to have your blood potassium levels checked on a regular basis while taking Potassium chloride.
If you're older or have kidney disease your doctor will watch you more carefully while you take Potassium chloride.
If Potassium chloride builds up in your body, it can cause heart problems that you might not feel until they're serious.

downsides_processed.orig: Potassium chloride causes nausea, vomiting, gas, belly pain, and diarrhea. Taking the extended release formulas or smaller doses with food will help.
You'll need to have your blood potassium levels checked on a regular basis while taking Potassium chloride.
If you're older or have kidney disease your doctor will watch you more carefully while you take Potassium chloride.
If Potassium chloride builds up in your body, it can cause heart problems that you might not feel until they're serious.

upsides: Extended-release doses (tablets or capsules) work well because the medicine is slowly absorbed. This helps reduce stomach upset.
Some people felt it was a hassle overall, but still worth taking it.

upsides_processed.orig: Extended-release doses (tablets or capsules) work well because the medicine is slowly absorbed. This helps reduce stomach upset.
Some people felt it was a hassle overall, but still worth taking it.

drugs.name: Potassium Chloride

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take each dose with a meal and full glass of water or other liquid.
Doses more than 20mEq should be split up and given twice a day.
You can also take a lower dose of Potassium chloride and eat extra foods that are high in potassium. Ask your doctor.
Tell your doctor if the tablets get stuck in your throat or you have trouble swallowing them. There may be other dosage forms you can try that work better for you.
Don't chew, crush or suck on the tablets, swallow them whole. The tablets can also be split in half (on the line), then that piece swallowed whole.
Even though the active medicine is completely absorbed, the empty shell capsule/tablet may not be and could show up in your stool. Don't be alarmed.
If using powder, you'll need to completely mix and dissolve one packet of in a minimum of 4-5 ounces of water or other liquid.
Some capsules can be opened and the medicine sprinkled onto soft food (applesauce, yogurt), then swallowed without chewing.

risks_warnings.title: High potassium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: High levels of potassium in your body can cause muscle weakness/paralysis and serious heartbeat problems (loss of signal between upper and lower parts of the heart that result in lost beats, fast, abnormal heart beats in the ventricle and complete loss of heartbeat). Don't take Potassium chloride with medicines that increase potassium (ACE inhibitors, potassium-sparing fluid pills, salt substitutes, etc.). Your doctor may order blood tests to check your potassium levels if you have a condition that could increase this risk.
risk_factors: Dose of Potassium chloride is too high
Taking with medicines that increase potassium

description_processed.orig: High levels of potassium in your body can cause muscle weakness/paralysis and serious heartbeat problems (loss of signal between upper and lower parts of the heart that result in lost beats, fast, abnormal heart beats in the ventricle and complete loss of heartbeat). Don't take Potassium chloride with medicines that increase potassium (ACE inhibitors, potassium-sparing fluid pills, salt substitutes, etc.). Your doctor may order blood tests to check your potassium levels if you have a condition that could increase this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Potassium chloride is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other options to treat your low potassium.

description_processed.orig: Using Potassium chloride is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other options to treat your low potassium.

risks_warnings.title: Serious stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Potassium chloride may cause stomach upset and irritation that can lead to serious and life-threatening stomach and intestinal ulcers, tears, bleeding, holes, and blockage. Theres less of a risk with wax matrix tablets. Stop taking any formulation of Potassium chloride immediately and get medical care if severe vomiting, belly pain,  bulging or bleeding occurs. People with esophageal problems or trouble emptying their stomach should try the oral liquid preparations.
risk_factors: People who can't walk or move well (immobility)

description_processed.orig: Potassium chloride may cause stomach upset and irritation that can lead to serious and life-threatening stomach and intestinal ulcers, tears, bleeding, holes, and blockage. Theres less of a risk with wax matrix tablets. Stop taking any formulation of Potassium chloride immediately and get medical care if severe vomiting, belly pain,  bulging or bleeding occurs. People with esophageal problems or trouble emptying their stomach should try the oral liquid preparations.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)
